intro: Eremurus zoae, commonly known as the white lily of the desert, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the genus Eremurus, which is part of the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the sunflower family. Eremurus zoae thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable species in its native habitat.
